intro: Appendicula cornuta var. formosana, commonly known as the Formosan horned appendicula, is a rare flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated floral bracts that resemble horns. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as montane forests. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
